intro: Polycarpaea longiflora var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, often blooming in the summer months. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
